subject: Science
title: Submarines and Deep-Sea Vehicles
description: A quick win: understand Submarines and Deep-Sea Vehicles.

hook.text: More people have been to space than to the deepest point of the ocean.

buildup.text: Military submarines typically dive to 300â€“500 m. The ocean goes much deeper.

discovery.text: Remotely operated vehicles (ROVs) can reach the deepest points without risking lives.

twist.text: In 2012, James Cameron solo-dove to the Mariana Trench in a custom submersible.

climax.text: New materials and designs are making deep-sea vehicles cheaper and more capable.

punchline.text: We send robots to the deep. Sending humans is still an extreme adventure.
